availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James S Pankey (1st ky cavalry regiment)

body.p: Born in 1808 in Kentucky. Married to Nancy Pankey. Children included Nancy and John W. Enlisted in First Kentucky Cavalry Regiment on October 20, 1861. Promoted from 1st Sergeant to 2nd Lieutenant, November 1, 1861; to Captain, June 14, 1864.

bibl.p: Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, citing p. 4, family 29, NARA microfilm publication M593 (Washington D.C.: National Archives and Records Administration, n.d.); FHL microfilm 545,987; Sergeant E. Tarrant, The Wild Riders of the First Kentucky Cavalry : a History of the Regiment, in the Great War of the Rebellion, 1861-1865 : Pathetic Scenes, Amusing Incidents, and Thrilling Episodes, a Regimental Roster, Prison Life, Adventures, and Escapes (New York: New York Public Library, 1894), 448.
